p: It is apparent that an individual cannot attain Ubuntu in isolation, but rather through interdependency and meaningful interactions with others. Ubuntu collectivism is characterised by ‘identity’ and ‘solidarity’. Community members will identify as ‘I’ in ‘We’ which serves as behavioural motivation to reach communal goals; and goal achievement is attained through solidarity by means of mutual aid, altruism and sympathy (Metz 2011).
